page.title: 14LOCAL INDUSTRY,CARSPHAIRN
page.content: {FARMING}One of the main industries in the area is hill sheep farming.The main reason for keeping the sheep is for breeding lambs which are sold for meat, but also a small income is to be gained from the sale of wool.Some farmers have beef cattle. The native breed is the Galloway.A few crops are grown to feed the animals in winter_ rape, and grass for silage and hay.Machines are now used to do many of the jobs which provided employment on the farm in the past. {FORESTRY}Some of the hill land previously used for sheep has been planted with conifers.The trees are now reaching maturity and are being felled and transported to Dalmellington, where they are made into pit props, to Irvine to be made into chipboard, or to Sweden's pulp mills to be made into paper.
